item.title: CS137-lecture-20210415
item.description: Memory technology # IM = instruction memory, DM = data memory RAM = random access memory, ROM = read only memory EEPROM = electrically erasable programmable read only memory SRAM = static RAM, DRAM = dynamic RAM Peak memory bandwidth example # \( 32\text{ bits} \cdot \frac{1\text{ byte} }{8\text{ bits} } = 4 \text{ bytes} \\ \) \( 1\text{ MB} = 1,000,000 \text{ bytes} \\ \) \( 1 \text{ Hz} = 1 \text{ cycle/second}\\ \) \( 1 \text{ MHz} = 1,000,000 \text{ cycles/second} \\\) \( 100 \text{ MHz} = 100,000,000 \text{ cycles/second} \\\) So,
